places.name: Colosseum
places.address: Piazza del Colosseo, 1, 00184 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: An iconic ancient amphitheater, the largest ever built, famous for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

places.name: Pantheon
places.address: Piazza della Rotonda, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: A former Roman temple, now a church, renowned for its impressive dome and oculus.

places.name: Trevi Fountain
places.address: Piazza di Trevi, 00187 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: A magnificent Baroque fountain, famous for the tradition of throwing coins into its waters for a return to Rome.

places.name: Roman Forum
places.address: Via della Salara Vecchia, 5/6, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: The center of ancient Roman public life, with ruins of government buildings, temples, and markets.

places.name: Vatican City (St. Peter's Basilica)
places.address: Piazza San Pietro, 00120 Citt√† del Vaticano
places.description: The smallest independent state in the world, home to the Pope, St. Peter's Basilica, and the Vatican Museums.

places.name: Castel Sant'Angelo
places.description: A towering cylindrical building on the right bank of the Tiber, initially Hadrian's mausoleum, later a fortress and castle.

places.name: Borghese Gallery and Museum
places.address: Piazzale Scipione Borghese, 5, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: A stunning art gallery housed in the former Villa Borghese Pinciana, featuring Bernini and Caravaggio masterpieces.

places.name: Piazza Navona
places.description: A vibrant public square built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian, famous for its fountains, including Bernini's Fountain of Four Rivers.

places.name: Villa Borghese
places.address: Piazzale Napoleone I, 00197 Roma RM, Italy
places.description: One of Rome's largest and most famous public parks, blending nature, art, and history. It houses the Borghese Gallery and Museum, beautiful gardens, fountains, and other attractions like the Bioparco (zoo) and a replica of Shakespeare's Globe Theatre.
